dct:title: Miami-Dade Stormwater Lines
dct:creator: Miami-Dade County
dct:license: Miami-Dade County provides this data for use "as is". The areas depicted by this map/data are approximate, and are not accurate to surveying or engineering standards. The maps/data shown here are for illustration purposes only and are not suitable for site-specific decision making. Information found here should not be used for making financial or any other commitments. dct:description:
A line feature class that represents all drainage pipes and conveyance systems such as outfalls, culverts, infiltration trenches, ditches in the drainage network within Miami-Dade County.

A line feature class that represents all drainage features for the Unincorporated Miami-Dade County Service Area (UMSA), which can be represented by lines in a map, are represented in this layer, such as outfalls, culverts, infiltration trenches, ditches in the drainage network. The data was collected through permit files, surveys and as-built(?), representing the best available information for each location at the time the layer was published.
prov:action:
#########
# GDSC ETL is performed in two steps: shell script to ETL data into postgres
# and then additional transformations with SQL in postGIS (if needed).
####

#########
# Step 1 - bash script (pseudo code)
####

# create directory structure and move into it
mkdir -p /data/mdc_stormwater_lines/{download,etl} && cd /data/mdc_stormwater_lines

# set update flag based on last update and update frequency
do_update=0 if date() < last_update + update_frequency else do_update = 1

# download if update flag is set:
if do_update == 1 then
  ogr2ogr -nln mdc_stormwater_lines download/mdc_stormwater_lines.geojson "https://services.arcgis.com/8Pc9XBTAsYuxx9Ny/arcgis/rest/services/StormWaterLine_gdb/FeatureServer/0/query?outFields=*&where=1%3D1&outSR=4326&f=geojson"

# replace column names Shape__Length and Shape__Area to avoid conflict when
# providing as service on ArcServer.
sed -i 's/Shape__Length/shape_length/gI; s/Shape__Area/shape_area/gI' download/mdc_stormwater_lines.geojson

# load into postGIS with:
  ogr2ogr -lco GEOMETRY_NAME=geom -f PostgreSQL PG:"<postgres connection>" download/mdc_stormwater_lines.geojson -nlt multilinestring -nln mdc_stormwater_lines

#########
# Step 2 - SQL script (pseudo code):
####

# remove duplicate points and make geometries valid:
UPDATE mdc_stormwater_lines
  SET geom=ST_MakeValid(ST_RemoveRepeatedPoints(geom));"

# add local geometry column and reproject existing geometries into local EPSG:
SELECT AddGeometryColumn (
  'mdc_stormwater_lines',
  'geom_local',2236,'multilinestring',2
);
UPDATE mdc_stormwater_lines
  SET geom_local=ST_MakeValid(ST_RemoveRepeatedPoints(ST_Transform(ST_Multi(geom),2236)));
CREATE INDEX mdc_stormwater_lines_geom_local_idx
  ON mdc_stormwater_lines
  USING GIST (geom_local);
NOTIFY pgrst, 'reload schema';"
dcat:contactPoint: University of Miami Libraries, Frost Institute for Data Science and Computing
gdsc:label: objectid
gdsc:attributes: map_label;Label as it appears on map;MDC;string
standard_detail;Standards detail;Public Works Manual and Survey;string
from_x1y1;Unique identifier of the structure where the pipe or trench starts;Survey;string
to_x2y2;Unique identifier of the structure where the pipe or trench ends;Survey;string
depth;Distance between grate elevation and bottom elevation;Survey;string
treatment;Yes/No Field, identifying treatment by infiltration methods;Survey;string
skew_angle;Pipe horizontal skew angle in relation to the headwall;Survey;string
column_no;Number of the Bridge columns or posts;Generated by mapper;string
source;Source of Data /document Identifier;Miami-Dade County SWUPD Records;string
sourcedate;Date of the date of the project permit, or survey;Miami-Dade County Records, SFWMD Permit records, Surveys;string
state_road;Identifies the State Roads;FDOT and PWWM Right-of-Way and Maintenance Agreement Records;string
last_modified_date;Last date modified by;Generated by mapper;string
fdot_type;Type according to FDOT Standard Designs;Survey;string
fdot_detail1;Detail 1 According to FDOT Standard Designs;Survey;string
fdot_detail2;Detail 2 According to FDOT Standard Designs;Survey;string
